title: KWWN
text:
KWWN (1100 <a href="AM%20broadcasting">AM</a> and 100.9 <a href="FM%20broadcasting">FM</a>) is a <a href="radio%20station">radio station</a> licensed to <a href="Las%20Vegas%2C%20Nevada">Las Vegas, Nevada</a>, <a href="United%20States">United States</a>. The station is owned by <a href="Lotus%20Communications">Lotus Communications</a>. Programming includes the <a href="UNLV%20Rebels">UNLV Rebels</a> <a href="UNLV%20Rebels%20football">football</a> and <a href="UNLV%20Runnin%27%20Rebels">men's basketball</a> teams, the <a href="Las%20Vegas%20Aces">Las Vegas Aces</a>, <a href="ESPN%20Radio">ESPN Radio</a> talk shows and play-by-play, and various local talk shows. Its studios are located in the unincorporated community of <a href="Spring%20Valley%2C%20Nevada">Spring Valley</a> in <a href="Clark%20County%2C%20Nevada">Clark County</a> and its transmitter is located in <a href="North%20Las%20Vegas%2C%20Nevada">North Las Vegas</a>.
Station history.
KWWN officially signed on in December 2007, and was running tests of its <a href="transmitter">transmitter</a> for several months. These tests were mainly to arrange the nighttime <a href="directional%20antenna">directional</a> signal of the station, so it would not interfere with nearby <a href="KNZZ">KNZZ</a> or other stations on 1100 <a href="kHz">kHz</a>. While testing, the station ran at half power (10,000 watts day and 1,000 watts night) to further limit the possibility of <a href="RF%20interference">interference</a>. <a href="1100%20AM">1100 AM</a> is a United States <a href="clear-channel">clear-channel</a> frequency, on which <a href="WTAM">WTAM</a> in <a href="Cleveland%2C%20Ohio">Cleveland, Ohio</a> is the dominant <a href="list%20of%20broadcast%20station%20classes%23AM">Class A</a> station. KWWN is currently running at its normal power.
Originally, KWWN simulcast sister station <a href="KRLV%20%28AM%29">KBAD</a>. Sometime in 2008, the simulcast ended; KBAD became the local affiliate of <a href="Fox%20Sports%20Radio">Fox Sports Radio</a>, while KWWN picked up the ESPN Radio affiliation. <a href="KENO%20%28AM%29">KENO</a>, which had been the FSR station, joined <a href="ESPN%20Deportes%20Radio">ESPN Deportes Radio</a>.
KWWN is the flagship station of the <a href="Las%20Vegas%20Aces">Las Vegas Aces</a> of the <a href="Women%27s%20National%20Basketball%20Association">Women's National Basketball Association</a>. Before the start of the 2018-19 season, the station was named as an affiliate of the <a href="Los%20Angeles%20Lakers%20radio%20networks">Los Angeles Lakers Radio Network</a> as <a href="Las%20Vegas">Las Vegas</a> doesn't have a team in the <a href="National%20Basketball%20Association">National Basketball Association</a>
